result.execSummary:
The defendant Arlanders Willis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Help defendant find a new payee, current one ran a negative balance and therefore received no medications.  Treatment provider at Ball Thereapy (Latesha Oglesby), should be removed.

miscConds.notes:
Pay Supervision fees as determined by the DOC and pay all applicable costs & surcharges, DV & DNA surcharge, during period of Probation.  Failure to pay is civil judgment.    
Restitution is set at $0 (zero).

Obtain and maintain employment and/ or do Community Service.
Obtain GED/ HSED.

NO firearms/ weapons.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/ or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence

NO CONTACT with victim, Dyaquisha H., without approval of agent and once all the conditions below are followed and AOR agent believes it to be safe for victim and children   
- completion of 1/2 of BIP sessions      
- cooperating with treatment and meds.      
Defendant may have contact with the victim through a 3rd party to arrange time with children, if supervised by an adult.   
NO drugs.   
NO alcohol.

Successfully complete:   
- Batterers Intervention counseling and continue programming,   
- Mental Health evaluation and treatment and take all prescribed medications.   
- Parenting classes.  
- Any other counseling and/ or treatment  deemed appropriate.

Participate in AODA assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.   
Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY; random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED pending Probation review on 04-24-15 at 1:30 p.m. BR 4
**7/17/15 STAY LIFTED as to five (5) days. Filed, signed Order for Commitment Time.
*9/3/2015  STAY LIFTED as to 30 days, forthwith.  Commitment For Conditon time signed and filed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Arlanders Willis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per PO Rabekah Polasky defendant is serving condition time and requests that review hearing be cancelled.

FOR BRANCH 38 by Br. 40:  Order for Commitment for Conditions Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Conditions signed and filed.
Commitment to be issued forthwith for 30 days condition time.

Defendant Arlanders Willis in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
DOC agent Rabekah Polasky also in court.
The Court finds that the defendant has not been complying with the conditions of probation.  The Court ordered the defendant to serve 5 DAYS of the condition time that was stayed to today's date; the stay on the balance of the time is to continue to the next court date.  Defendant taken into custody.  Filed, signed Order For Commitment Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.
Case adjourned to 9-11-2015 at 1:30 p.m. for probation review hearing in Branch 38.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.   mld

Defendant Arlanders Willis in court with Attorney Matthew Lamke.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DOC Agent Rabekah Polansky also in Court.  The Court ordered another review hearing to further monitor the defendant.  The Court ordered the stay on the condition time to continue until the next court date.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Arlanders Willis in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Arlanders Willis in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #1, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered dismissal of the Use of a Dangerous Weapon Enhancer as to COUNT #2: 

AS TO COUNT #2: (w/o the weapon enhancer), Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Dyaquisha H.  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 26 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 45 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and Treatment 
   and take all prescribed medications.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Dyaquisha H., without 
  approval of agent and once all the conditions 
  below are followed and AOR.  Agent believes it be 
  be safe for victim and children.  Completion 
  of 1/2 BIP sessions.  Cooperating with 
  treatment and meds.  
* Defendant may have contact with the victim
   through a third party to arrange time with children.
   --- if supervised by an adult.
* Obtain GED/HSED.
* Obtain and maintain employment 
   and/or do community service. 
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
*  Help defendant find a new payee, current one ran a 
    negative balance and therefore, received no medications.
    Treatment provider at Ball Therapy (Latesha Oglesby), 
    should be removed.
* Restitution is set at zero.
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 4 ON 4-24-2015 AT 1:30 PM.
 48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
 Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   
Court vacates the Jury Trial date of 5-20-2015 at 8:30 am, Branch 4.  mld
Upon the request of defense counsel, case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 3-11-2015 at 1:30 pm.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 5-20-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court, defendant Arlanders Willis not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Scheduling Conference held off the record.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Case is adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 5-20-2015 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld  Jury trial scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

BRANCH 23 FOR BRANCH 40
Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court, defendant Arlanders Willis not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Case adjourned to branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Dyaquisha H.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Arlanders Willis in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  
Defendant Arlanders Willis in custody.  Gary D. 
Mahkorn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  
Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 08:30 am. in Branch 23 for Branch 4
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
